The **1st century** was the [century](/wiki/Century "Century") that lasted
from [AD 1](/wiki/AD_1 "AD 1") to [AD 100](/wiki/AD_100 "AD 100") according to
the [Julian calendar](/wiki/Julian_calendar "Julian calendar"). It is often
written as the **1st century[AD](/wiki/Anno_Domini "Anno Domini")**[1] or
**1st century[CE](/wiki/Common_Era "Common Era")** to distinguish it from the
[1st century BC](/wiki/1st_century_BC "1st century BC") (or BCE) which
preceded it. The 1st century is considered part of the [Classical
era](/wiki/Classical_era "Classical era"), epoch, or [historical
period](/wiki/History_by_period "History by period").

During this period, Europe, North Africa and the Near East fell under
increasing domination by the [Roman Empire](/wiki/Roman_Empire "Roman
Empire"), which continued expanding, most notably conquering
[Britain](/wiki/Britannia "Britannia") under the emperor
[Claudius](/wiki/Claudius "Claudius") ([AD 43](/wiki/AD_43 "AD 43")). The
reforms introduced by [Augustus](/wiki/Augustus "Augustus") during his long
reign stabilized the empire after the turmoil of the previous century's civil
wars. Later in the century the [Julio-Claudian dynasty](/wiki/Julio-
Claudian_dynasty "Julio-Claudian dynasty"), which had been founded by
[Augustus](/wiki/Augustus "Augustus"), came to an end with the suicide of
[Nero](/wiki/Nero "Nero") in [AD 68](/wiki/AD_68 "AD 68"). There followed the
famous [Year of Four Emperors](/wiki/Year_of_Four_Emperors "Year of Four
Emperors"), a brief period of civil war and instability, which was finally
brought to an end by [Vespasian](/wiki/Vespasian "Vespasian"), ninth Roman
emperor, and founder of the [Flavian dynasty](/wiki/Flavian_dynasty "Flavian
dynasty"). The Roman Empire generally experienced a period of prosperity and
dominance in this period and the First Century is remembered as part of the
Empire's golden age.

The 1st century saw the [appearance of
Christianity](/wiki/Christianity_in_the_1st_century "Christianity in the 1st
century").

China continued to be dominated by the [Han Dynasty](/wiki/Han_Dynasty "Han
Dynasty"), despite a fourteen-year interruption by the [Xin
dynasty](/wiki/Xin_dynasty "Xin dynasty") under [Wang Mang](/wiki/Wang_Mang
"Wang Mang"). Han rule was restored in [AD 23](/wiki/AD_23 "AD 23"); Wang
Mang's rule represents the watershed between the Western/Former Han and the
Eastern/Later Han. [The capital was also
moved](/wiki/History_of_the_Han_Dynasty "History of the Han Dynasty") from
[Chang'an](/wiki/Chang%27an "Chang'an") to [Luoyang](/wiki/Luoyang "Luoyang").

## Regional events and
politics[[edit](/w/index.php?title=1st_century&action=edit&section=1 "Edit
section: Regional events and politics")]

  * [Western Europe](/wiki/Western_Europe "Western Europe"): [Celtic](/wiki/Celts "Celts"), [Germanic](/wiki/Germanic_peoples "Germanic peoples"), [Saami](/wiki/Sami_people "Sami people") and [Finnic](/wiki/Finns "Finns") [tribal](/wiki/Tribe "Tribe") [chiefdom](/wiki/Chiefdom "Chiefdom") and the [Roman Empire](/wiki/Roman_Empire "Roman Empire")
  * [Eastern Europe](/wiki/Eastern_Europe "Eastern Europe"): [Roman Empire](/wiki/Roman_Empire "Roman Empire"), [Dacian](/wiki/Dacians "Dacians"), [Sarmatian](/wiki/Sarmatians "Sarmatians"), [Venedae](/wiki/West_Slavs "West Slavs") and [Balt](/wiki/Balts "Balts") [tribal](/wiki/Tribe "Tribe") [chiefdoms](/wiki/Chiefdom "Chiefdom")
  * [North Africa](/wiki/North_Africa "North Africa"): [Roman Empire](/wiki/Roman_Empire "Roman Empire"), [Garamantes](/wiki/Garamantes "Garamantes"), [Mauri](/wiki/Mauri_people "Mauri people"), [Libyan](/wiki/Punics "Punics") and [Gaetulian](/wiki/Gaetuli "Gaetuli") [tribal](/wiki/Tribe "Tribe") [chiefdoms](/wiki/Chiefdom "Chiefdom")
  * [West Africa](/wiki/West_Africa "West Africa"): [Gur](/wiki/Gur_languages "Gur languages"), [Kwa](/wiki/Volta%E2%80%93Niger_languages "Volta–Niger languages"), [Soninke](/wiki/Soninke_people "Soninke people") and [Mande](/wiki/Mand%C3%A9_peoples "Mandé peoples") [tribal](/wiki/Tribe "Tribe") [chiefdoms](/wiki/Chiefdom "Chiefdom")
  * [Central Africa](/wiki/Central_Africa "Central Africa"): [Bantu tribes](/wiki/Bantu_peoples "Bantu peoples"), collapsing [Nok culture](/wiki/Nok_culture "Nok culture") [Nok civilization](/wiki/Nok_civilization "Nok civilization")
  * [East Africa](/wiki/East_Africa "East Africa"): [Kingdom of Kush](/wiki/Kingdom_of_Kush "Kingdom of Kush"), Kingdom of [Blemmyes](/wiki/Blemmyes "Blemmyes"), [Kingdom of Aksum](/wiki/Kingdom_of_Aksum "Kingdom of Aksum")
  * [Southern Africa](/wiki/Southern_Africa "Southern Africa"): [Bantu tribes](/wiki/Bantu_peoples "Bantu peoples"), [Khoisan](/wiki/Khoisan "Khoisan").
  * [Western Asia](/wiki/Western_Asia "Western Asia"): [Roman](/wiki/Roman_Empire "Roman Empire") and [Parthian Empires](/wiki/Parthian_Empire "Parthian Empire"), [Sabaean](/wiki/Sabaeans "Sabaeans") and Arabian Kingdoms, smaller tribes.
  * [Central Asia](/wiki/Central_Asia "Central Asia"): [Kushan Empire](/wiki/Kushan_Empire "Kushan Empire"), [Sarmatian](/wiki/Sarmatian "Sarmatian"), [Dahae](/wiki/Dahae "Dahae") and other [Iranian](/wiki/Iranian_peoples "Iranian peoples") [tribal](/wiki/Tribe "Tribe") [chiefdoms](/wiki/Chiefdom "Chiefdom")
  * [South Asia](/wiki/South_Asia "South Asia"): [Kushan Empire](/wiki/Kushan_Empire "Kushan Empire"), [Western Satraps](/wiki/Western_Satraps "Western Satraps"), [Satavahana Empire](/wiki/Satavahana_dynasty "Satavahana dynasty"), [Dravidian Kingdoms](/wiki/Tamilakam "Tamilakam"), Kingdom of [Kalinga](/wiki/Kalinga_\(historical_region\) "Kalinga \(historical region\)"), [Indo-Parthian Kingdom](/wiki/Indo-Parthian_Kingdom "Indo-Parthian Kingdom"), [Zhangzhung](/wiki/Zhangzhung "Zhangzhung").
  * [Southeast Asia](/wiki/Southeast_Asia "Southeast Asia"): [Mandala](/wiki/Mandala_\(Southeast_Asian_political_model\) "Mandala \(Southeast Asian political model\)") of [city-states](/wiki/City-state "City-state"), [Kingdom of Funan](/wiki/Kingdom_of_Funan "Kingdom of Funan")
  * [East Asia](/wiki/East_Asia "East Asia"): [Han Dynasty](/wiki/Han_dynasty "Han dynasty"), [Yamatai](/wiki/Yamatai "Yamatai"), [Xiongnu](/wiki/Xiongnu "Xiongnu") and [Xianbei](/wiki/Xianbei "Xianbei") [tribal](/wiki/Tribe "Tribe") [chiefdoms](/wiki/Chiefdom "Chiefdom"), [Three Kingdoms of Korea](/wiki/Three_Kingdoms_of_Korea "Three Kingdoms of Korea") ([Goguryeo](/wiki/Goguryeo "Goguryeo"), [Baekje](/wiki/Baekje "Baekje") and [Silla](/wiki/Silla "Silla")).
  * [North America](/wiki/North_America "North America"):
  * [Central America](/wiki/Central_America "Central America"): [Mayan](/wiki/Maya_civilization "Maya civilization"), [Teotihuacan](/wiki/Teotihuacan "Teotihuacan") and [Zapotec](/wiki/Zapotec_civilization "Zapotec civilization") [civilizations](/wiki/Civilization "Civilization").
  * [Caribbean](/wiki/Caribbean "Caribbean"):
  * [South America](/wiki/South_America "South America"): [Nazca](/wiki/Nazca_culture "Nazca culture"), [Moche](/wiki/Moche_culture "Moche culture") [civilizations](/wiki/Civilization "Civilization"), [Tairona](/wiki/Tairona "Tairona") [tribal](/wiki/Tribe "Tribe") [chiefdoms](/wiki/Chiefdom "Chiefdom").

## Events[[edit](/w/index.php?title=1st_century&action=edit&section=2 "Edit
section: Events")]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/f/f8/Ring_Lady.JPG/150px-
Ring_Lady.JPG)](/wiki/File:Ring_Lady.JPG)

[](/wiki/File:Ring_Lady.JPG "Enlarge")

The skeleton called the "Ring Lady" unearthed in Herculaneum, one of the
victims of the eruption of [Mount Vesuvius](/wiki/Mount_Vesuvius "Mount
Vesuvius") in [AD 79](/wiki/AD_79 "AD 79")

  * Early 1st century – [Augustus of Primaporta](/wiki/Augustus_of_Primaporta "Augustus of Primaporta"), (perhaps a copy of a bronze statue of ca. [20 BC](/wiki/20_BC "20 BC")), is made. It is now kept in [Musei Vaticani](/wiki/Musei_Vaticani "Musei Vaticani"), [Braccio Nuovo](/wiki/Braccio_Nuovo "Braccio Nuovo"), [Rome](/wiki/Rome "Rome").
  * Early 1st century – [Gemma Augustea](/wiki/Gemma_Augustea "Gemma Augustea") is made. It is now kept at [Kunsthistorisches Museum](/wiki/Kunsthistorisches_Museum "Kunsthistorisches Museum"), [Vienna](/wiki/Vienna "Vienna").
  * Early 1st century – [House of the Silver Wedding](/wiki/House_of_the_Silver_Wedding "House of the Silver Wedding"), [Pompeii](/wiki/Pompeii "Pompeii"), is built. Excavated in [1893](/wiki/1893 "1893"), the year of the silver wedding anniversary of [Italy](/wiki/Italy "Italy")'s King Humbert and his wife, [Margherita of Savoy](/wiki/Margherita_of_Savoy "Margherita of Savoy"), who have supported archaeological fieldwork at Pompeii.
  * Early 1st century - Inner shrine, [Ise, Mie](/wiki/Ise,_Mie "Ise, Mie"), [Mie Prefecture](/wiki/Mie_Prefecture "Mie Prefecture"), is built. [Yayoi period](/wiki/Yayoi_period "Yayoi period").
  * [AD 1](/wiki/AD_1 "AD 1"): [Lions](/wiki/Lion "Lion") became [extinct](/wiki/Extinct "Extinct") in [Western Europe](/wiki/Western_Europe "Western Europe").
  * [AD 2](/wiki/AD_2 "AD 2"): First [census](/wiki/Census "Census") of China, the census is one of the most accurate in Chinese history.
  * [AD 6](/wiki/AD_6 "AD 6"): [Census of Quirinius](/wiki/Census_of_Quirinius "Census of Quirinius").
  * [AD 7](/wiki/AD_7 "AD 7"): Prince [Cunobeline](/wiki/Cunobeline "Cunobeline") of [Catuvellauni](/wiki/Catuvellauni "Catuvellauni") defeats the [Trinovantes](/wiki/Trinovantes "Trinovantes") in [England](/wiki/England "England") and establishes his capital at [Camulodunum](/wiki/Camulodunum "Camulodunum") (modern-day [Colchester](/wiki/Colchester "Colchester")).
  * [AD 9](/wiki/AD_9 "AD 9"): Three Roman legions were ambushed and destroyed at [Teutoberg Forest](/wiki/Teutoberg_Forest "Teutoberg Forest") by Germans under the leadership of [Arminius](/wiki/Arminius "Arminius").
  * [AD 9](/wiki/AD_9 "AD 9"): Prince Cunobeline is crowned King of Catuvellauni, his Kingdom dominates Southern England.
  * [AD 9](/wiki/AD_9 "AD 9")–[23](/wiki/AD_23 "AD 23"): [Wang Mang](/wiki/Wang_Mang "Wang Mang") temporarily overthrew the [Han dynasty](/wiki/Han_dynasty "Han dynasty") of [China](/wiki/China "China").
  * [AD 9](/wiki/AD_9 "AD 9")–[23](/wiki/AD_23 "AD 23"): [Xin dynasty](/wiki/Xin_dynasty "Xin dynasty").
  * [AD 14](/wiki/AD_14 "AD 14"): [Augustus Caesar](/wiki/Augustus_Caesar "Augustus Caesar"), first emperor of Rome, dies. His adopted son, stepson and son-in-law [Tiberius](/wiki/Tiberius "Tiberius") is his successor.
  * [AD 25](/wiki/AD_25 "AD 25"): The Han dynasty is restored by Liu Xiu who proclaims himself [Emperor Guangwu of Han](/wiki/Emperor_Guangwu_of_Han "Emperor Guangwu of Han").
  * [AD 28](/wiki/AD_28 "AD 28")–[75](/wiki/AD_75 "AD 75"): [Emperor Ming of Han](/wiki/Emperor_Ming_of_Han "Emperor Ming of Han"), [Buddhism](/wiki/Buddhism "Buddhism") reaches [China](/wiki/China "China").
  * Humans arrive on [Pentecost Island](/wiki/Pentecost_Island "Pentecost Island") and establish the [Bunlap](/wiki/Bunlap "Bunlap") tribe, among others.
  * c. [AD 29](/wiki/AD_29 "AD 29"): [Jesus begins his ministry](/wiki/Chronology_of_Jesus#Years_of_preaching "Chronology of Jesus") (traditional date).[2][3][4][5][6][7][8]
  * c. [AD 33](/wiki/AD_33 "AD 33"): [The Crucifixion of Jesus](/wiki/Chronology_of_Jesus#Date_of_death "Chronology of Jesus") (traditional date).[9][10][11]
  * c. [AD 33](/wiki/AD_33 "AD 33")–[36](/wiki/AD_36 "AD 36"): [Conversion of Paul the Apostle](/wiki/Conversion_of_Paul_the_Apostle "Conversion of Paul the Apostle").[12][13][14]
  * [AD 40](/wiki/AD_40 "AD 40"): Succession crisis erupts at King Cunobeline's court and his exiled younger son Prince Adminius flees to the court of Caligula in Rome.
  * [AD 40](/wiki/AD_40 "AD 40"): Emperor Caligula plans to invade Britain, but forgets to bring an army, he instead declares war upon the sea, whipping it and taking shells as prisoners.
  * [AD 40](/wiki/AD_40 "AD 40")–[43](/wiki/AD_43 "AD 43"): [Revolts](/wiki/Trung_sisters%27_rebellion "Trung sisters' rebellion") erupts in Vietnam by the [Trung sisters](/wiki/Trung_sisters "Trung sisters").
  * [AD 42](/wiki/AD_42 "AD 42"): King Cunobeline dies, his son Caratacus becomes King. He and his brother conquer much of South-Eastern England, expanding territory into Atrebates, driving out King Verica. King Verica travels to Rome to the court of Claudius to help reclaim his throne.
  * [AD 43](/wiki/AD_43 "AD 43"): [Roman conquest of Britain](/wiki/Roman_conquest_of_Britain "Roman conquest of Britain") begins. London is founded (although it could have existed centuries before this date).
  * [AD 44](/wiki/AD_44 "AD 44"): Death of [Herod Agrippa](/wiki/Agrippa_I "Agrippa I").
  * [AD 41](/wiki/AD_41 "AD 41")–[54](/wiki/AD_54 "AD 54"): Rachias, an [ambassador](/wiki/Ambassador "Ambassador") sent from [Sri Lanka](/wiki/Sri_Lanka "Sri Lanka") to the court of [Claudius](/wiki/Claudius "Claudius").
  * [Buddhist](/wiki/Buddhist "Buddhist") monks in [Sri Lanka](/wiki/Sri_Lanka "Sri Lanka") first write down [Buddha](/wiki/Gautama_Buddha "Gautama Buddha")'s teachings, creating the [Pali](/wiki/Pali "Pali") canon.
  * The regions of present-day [Afghanistan](/wiki/Afghanistan "Afghanistan"), [Pakistan](/wiki/Pakistan "Pakistan") and [North India](/wiki/North_India "North India") come under the control of the [Kushans](/wiki/Kushans "Kushans"), a nomadic people forced out of northwest [China](/wiki/China "China") by the [Han Dynasty](/wiki/Han_Dynasty "Han Dynasty").
  * [Tacitus](/wiki/Tacitus "Tacitus") mentions the [Suiones](/wiki/Suiones "Suiones"), who will one day be called the [Swedes](/wiki/Swedish_people "Swedish people").
  * [Kaundinya](/wiki/Kaundinya "Kaundinya"), an Indian [brahmin](/wiki/Brahmin "Brahmin") marries Soma and establishes the pre-[Angkor](/wiki/Angkor "Angkor") [Cambodian Kingdom](/wiki/History_of_Cambodia "History of Cambodia") of [Funan](/wiki/Kingdom_of_Funan "Kingdom of Funan").
  * The [Goths](/wiki/Goths "Goths") settle in northern [Poland](/wiki/Poland "Poland"), which they called [Gothiscandza](/wiki/Gothiscandza "Gothiscandza"), and shape the [Wielbark culture](/wiki/Wielbark_culture "Wielbark culture").
  * c. [AD 50](/wiki/AD_50 "AD 50"): [Christian](/wiki/Christian "Christian") [Council of Jerusalem](/wiki/Council_of_Jerusalem "Council of Jerusalem").
  * Mid-1st century – Wall niche, from garden in [Pompeii](/wiki/Pompeii "Pompeii"), is made. It is now kept at [Fitzwilliam Museum](/wiki/Fitzwilliam_Museum "Fitzwilliam Museum"), [University of Cambridge](/wiki/University_of_Cambridge "University of Cambridge"), England.
  * Mid-1st century – Detail of a wall painting in the [House of M. Lucretius Fronto](/w/index.php?title=House_of_M._Lucretius_Fronto&action=edit&redlink=1 "House of M. Lucretius Fronto \(page does not exist\)"), [Pompeii](/wiki/Pompeii "Pompeii"), is made.
  * [AD 58](/wiki/AD_58 "AD 58")–[88](/wiki/AD_88 "AD 88"): [Rule of Ming and Zhang](/wiki/Rule_of_Ming_and_Zhang "Rule of Ming and Zhang").
  * [AD 60](/wiki/AD_60 "AD 60"): Queen [Boudica](/wiki/Boudica "Boudica") of The Iceni in England launches a rebellion against The Romans. Tens of thousands die and the Roman army is massively damaged. The Rebellion fails and Boadicea commits suicide by poisoning herself. Three major cities are obliterated.
  * [AD 64](/wiki/AD_64 "AD 64"): [Great Fire of Rome](/wiki/Great_Fire_of_Rome "Great Fire of Rome"), first Roman mass [Persecution of Christians](/wiki/Persecution_of_Christians "Persecution of Christians"), earliest significant recognition of [Christians](/wiki/Christians "Christians") in [Rome](/wiki/Rome "Rome").
  * [AD 66](/wiki/AD_66 "AD 66")–[73](/wiki/AD_73 "AD 73"): [First Jewish-Roman War](/wiki/First_Jewish-Roman_War "First Jewish-Roman War").
  * [AD 69](/wiki/AD_69 "AD 69"): [Cartimandua](/wiki/Cartimandua "Cartimandua"), Queen of the Brigantes in Northern England, is overthrown in a civil war. Her unpopular alliance with Rome, the betrayal of Caratacus and her love for someone other than her husband are the three reasons which led to her demise. The Action enraged the Romans so much that they conquered and annexed The Kingdom.
  * [AD 70](/wiki/AD_70 "AD 70"): destruction of [Herod's Temple](/wiki/Herod%27s_Temple "Herod's Temple") in [Jerusalem](/wiki/Jerusalem "Jerusalem") by the Romans under [Titus](/wiki/Titus "Titus").
  * [AD 79](/wiki/AD_79 "AD 79"): [Pompeii](/wiki/Pompeii "Pompeii") and [Herculaneum](/wiki/Herculaneum "Herculaneum") destroyed by eruption of [Mount Vesuvius](/wiki/Mount_Vesuvius "Mount Vesuvius").
  * [AD 80](/wiki/AD_80 "AD 80"): The [Colosseum](/wiki/Colosseum "Colosseum") is finished.
  * [Jewish](/wiki/Jewish "Jewish") [Council of Jamnia](/wiki/Council_of_Jamnia "Council of Jamnia").
  * Spread of the [Roman Empire](/wiki/Roman_Empire "Roman Empire"), reaches largest size under [Trajan](/wiki/Trajan "Trajan").
  * Late 1st century—Cityscape, detail of a Second Style wall painting from a bedroom in the House of [Publius Fannius Synistor](/w/index.php?title=Publius_Fannius_Synistor&action=edit&redlink=1 "Publius Fannius Synistor \(page does not exist\)"), [Boscoreale](/wiki/Boscoreale "Boscoreale"), is made. It is now at The [Metropolitan Museum of Art](/wiki/Metropolitan_Museum_of_Art "Metropolitan Museum of Art"), [New York](/wiki/New_York_City "New York City").
  * The painting "Alexander the Great confronts Darius III at the Battle of Issos", detail of mosaic floor decoration from [Pompeii](/wiki/Pompeii "Pompeii"), [Italy](/wiki/Italy "Italy") is made. It is a Roman copy after a Greek painting of c. [310 BC](/wiki/310_BC "310 BC"), perhaps by [Philoxenos](/wiki/Philoxenus_of_Eretria "Philoxenus of Eretria") or Helen of Egypt. It is now at [Museo Archeologico Nazionale](/wiki/Naples_National_Archaeological_Museum "Naples National Archaeological Museum"), [Naples](/wiki/Naples "Naples"), [Italy](/wiki/Italy "Italy").
  * Late 1st century – Bedroom, from the House of Publius Fannius Synistor, [Boscoreale](/wiki/Boscoreale "Boscoreale") is made. It is reconstructed with later furnishings at The [Metropolitan Museum of Art](/wiki/Metropolitan_Museum_of_Art "Metropolitan Museum of Art"), [New York](/wiki/New_York_City "New York City").
  * Late 1st century – Seascape, detail of a wall painting from [Villa Farnesina](/wiki/Villa_Farnesina "Villa Farnesina"), [Rome](/wiki/Rome "Rome"), is made.
  * Late 1st century – Young Woman Writing, detail of a wall painting, from [Pompeii](/wiki/Pompeii "Pompeii"), is made. It is now kept at [Museo Archeologico Nazionale](/wiki/Naples_National_Archaeological_Museum "Naples National Archaeological Museum"), [Naples](/wiki/Naples "Naples").
  * Late 1st century – Mausoleum under Construction, relief from the tomb of the [Haterius](/w/index.php?title=Haterius&action=edit&redlink=1 "Haterius \(page does not exist\)") family, [Via Labicana](/wiki/Via_Labicana "Via Labicana"), [Rome](/wiki/Rome "Rome"), is made. It is now kept at [Musei Vaticani](/wiki/Musei_Vaticani "Musei Vaticani"), [Museo Gregoriano Profano](/w/index.php?title=Museo_Gregoriano_Profano&action=edit&redlink=1 "Museo Gregoriano Profano \(page does not exist\)"), [ex Lateranese](/w/index.php?title=Ex_Lateranese&action=edit&redlink=1 "Ex Lateranese \(page does not exist\)"), [Rome](/wiki/Rome "Rome").
  * Late 1st century – Middle-Aged Flavian Woman, is made. It is now kept at [Musei Vaticani](/wiki/Musei_Vaticani "Musei Vaticani"), [Museo Gregoriano Profano](/w/index.php?title=Museo_Gregoriano_Profano&action=edit&redlink=1 "Museo Gregoriano Profano \(page does not exist\)"), [ex Lateranese](/w/index.php?title=Ex_Lateranese&action=edit&redlink=1 "Ex Lateranese \(page does not exist\)"), [Rome](/wiki/Rome "Rome").
  * c. Late 1st century-early 2nd century – Buddha and Attendants, from [Katra Keshavdev](/w/index.php?title=Katra_Keshavdev&action=edit&redlink=1 "Katra Keshavdev \(page does not exist\)"), [Mathura](/wiki/Mathura "Mathura"), [Madhya Pradesh](/wiki/Madhya_Pradesh "Madhya Pradesh"), [India](/wiki/India "India"), is made. Kushan period. It is now kept at [Mathura Museum](/wiki/Mathura_Museum "Mathura Museum").
  * 1st-2nd centuries - Tomb model of a house, is made. Eastern [Han dynasty](/wiki/Han_dynasty "Han dynasty"). It is now kept at The [Nelson-Atkins Museum of Art](/wiki/Nelson-Atkins_Museum_of_Art "Nelson-Atkins Museum of Art"), [Kansas City](/wiki/Kansas_City,_Missouri "Kansas City, Missouri"), [Missouri](/wiki/Missouri "Missouri").

## Inventions, discoveries,
introductions[[edit](/w/index.php?title=1st_century&action=edit&section=6
"Edit section: Inventions, discoveries, introductions")]

  * [Codex](/wiki/Codex "Codex"), the first form of the modern book, appears in the Roman Empire
  * [AD 78](/wiki/AD_78 "AD 78"): the beginning of the Saka Era used by South Asian calendars.
  * [Bookbinding](/wiki/Bookbinding "Bookbinding")
  * Various inventions by [Hero of Alexandria](/wiki/Hero_of_Alexandria "Hero of Alexandria"), including the [steam turbine](/wiki/Steam_turbine "Steam turbine") (aeolipile), [water organ](/wiki/Water_organ "Water organ"), and various other water-powered machines.
  * [AD 31](/wiki/AD_31 "AD 31"): the [Han Dynasty](/wiki/Han_Dynasty "Han Dynasty") Chinese engineer and statesman [Tu Shih](/wiki/Tu_Shih "Tu Shih") (d. [AD 38](/wiki/AD_38 "AD 38")) from [Nanyang](/wiki/Nanyang,_Henan "Nanyang, Henan") invented the first-known [hydraulic](/wiki/Hydraulic "Hydraulic")-powered [bellows](/wiki/Bellows "Bellows") to heat the [blast furnace](/wiki/Blast_furnace "Blast furnace") in smelting [cast iron](/wiki/Cast_iron "Cast iron"). He used a complex mechanical device that was powered by the rushing current against a [waterwheel](/wiki/Waterwheel "Waterwheel"), a practice that would continue in China.
  * Although [Philo of Byzantium](/wiki/Philo_of_Byzantium "Philo of Byzantium") described the saqiya [chain pump](/wiki/Chain_pump "Chain pump") in the early 2nd century BC, the square-pallet [chain pump](/wiki/Chain_pump "Chain pump") was innovated in China during this century, mentioned first by the philosopher [Wang Chong](/wiki/Wang_Chong "Wang Chong") around [AD 80](/wiki/AD_80 "AD 80"). Wang Chong also accurately described the [water cycle](/wiki/Water_cycle "Water cycle") in [meteorology](/wiki/Meteorology "Meteorology"), and argued against the mainstream 'radiating influence' theory for [solar eclipses](/wiki/Solar_eclipse "Solar eclipse"), the latter of which was accepted by many, including [Zhang Heng](/wiki/Zhang_Heng "Zhang Heng").
  * The Chinese astronomer [Liu Xin](/wiki/Liu_Xin "Liu Xin") (d. [AD 23](/wiki/AD_23 "AD 23")) documented 1080 different stars, amongst other achievements.
  * End of 1st century – [codex](/wiki/Codex "Codex") replaces the [scroll](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll").
